Longboxed Helpers Module¶

longboxed.helpers¶

longboxed helpers module

class longboxed.helpers.JSONEncoder(skipkeys=False, ensure_ascii=True, check_circular=True, allow_nan=True, sort_keys=False, indent=None, separators=None, encoding='utf-8', default=None)[source]¶

Custom JSONEncoder which respects objects that include the JsonSerializer mixin.

class longboxed.helpers.JsonSerializer[source]¶

A mixin that can be used to mark a SQLAlchemy model class which implements a to_json() method. The to_json() method is used in conjuction with the custom JSONEncoder class. By default this mixin will assume all properties of the SQLAlchemy model are to be visible in the JSON output. Extend this class to customize which properties are public, hidden or modified before being being passed to the JSON serializer.

longboxed.helpers.current_wednesday()[source]¶

Gets the current weeks wednesday

longboxed.helpers.get_week(date, multiplier=0)[source]¶

Returns Sunday and Saturday of the week the ‘date’ argument is currently in. The ‘multiplier’ argument provides the ability to navigate multiple weeks into the future and past

longboxed.helpers.last_wednesday()[source]¶

Get last week’s Wednesday as a Date object

longboxed.helpers.mail_content(recipients, sender, subject, content, attachment=None)[source]¶

Generic function allowing for easy sending of email. A Mail from :module:`longboxed.core` must be in the applications context

Parameters:
  • recipients – list of email address strings
  • sender – sending email address
  • subject – message subject string
  • content – html content
  • attachment – plain text attachment
longboxed.helpers.next_wednesday()[source]¶

Gets next weeks wendesday

longboxed.helpers.register_blueprints(app, package_name, package_path)[source]¶

Register all Blueprint instances on the specified Flask application found in all modules for the specified package.

Parameters:
  • app – the Flask application
  • package_name – the package name
  • package_path – the package path
longboxed.helpers.strip_tags(html)[source]¶

Strips a string of all html tags

longboxed.helpers.two_wednesdays()[source]¶

Gets two wednesdays from now

longboxed.helpers.wednesday(date, multiplier=0)[source]¶

Given a date, returns a Date() object containing the week’s wednesday. A week is defined as Sunday thru Saturday. The ‘multiplier’ argument provides the ability navigate multiple weeks into the future and past

Parameters:
  • date – Date object used to center in on desired week
  • multiplier – int object that moves the date forward or backward
